1 sass Colors and Sass Init

Documentation for colors and Sass mixins and variables.

Source: _init.scss, line 1

1.1 sass.init Initialization partial

To make it easier to use all variables and mixins in any Sass file in this project, each .scss file has a @import 'init'; declaration. The _init.scss file is in charge of importing all the other partials needed for the project.

The initialization partial is organized in this way:

  • First we import Sass modules.
  • Next we set any shared Sass variables.
  • Last we define our custom mixins for this project.
Source: _init.scss, line 9

1.2 sass.libraries 3rd party libraries

The following sass modules are shared with all .scss files:

  • Bootstrap
    • Functions
    • Mixins
    • Utilities
    • Variables
Source: _init.scss, line 25

1.3 sass.variables Shared Sass variables

We import our variables so they are available to all .scss files.

Bootstrap provides many variables which can be customized/overridden. More information about variables provided by Bootstrap is available in the Bootstrap theming documentation.

Bootstrap convention says variables should follow the $component-state-property-size formula for consistent naming. Ex: $nav-link-disabled-color and $modal-content-box-shadow-xs.

Source: _init.scss, line 40

1.3.1 sass.variables.colors Color system

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

Bootstrap defines a set of all colors, as well as a smaller palette of theme colors and a set of grays.

UW Medicine brand guidelines define a smaller set of colors, which are divided into a primary and secondary palette.

Example
Blue
Indigo
Purple
Pink
Red
Orange
Yellow
Green
Teal
Cyan
Markup: init/colors/colors.twig

Source: init/colors/_colors.scss, line 1

1.3.2 sass.variables.typography Typography

Typography variable and style overrides from Bootstrap _variables.scss. All available variables have been copied over, but those variables whose value is not changed here are commented out.

To change the value of a default variable, uncomment the line and remove the !default flag.

Source: init/typography/_typography.scss, line 1
